purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of concepts associated with the management of risk over the full life cycle of a system.

p.b: Problems with Risk module form Phil Spibey, post Funchal 2007 meeting

usage_guide.p: Jochen and I made some changes to the Risk resource schema and Risk module last week which improved the situation.

However, there is still a problem with how Risk is modelled which only came to light when fixing other problems in AP233. Basically the Risk resource tries to cover all aspects of Risk, including approvals. This therefore requires the resource part to reference the Approval MIM, which I believe is not allowed. The recommendation I have is that the risk resource should deal with the concepts of risk and that is all. Risk approval should be handled in the risk module, which should then use the risk and approval resources.

I realise this means further changes to both the risk module and risk resource, but I believe it is the right direction to take things. At the present time I have made further changes to part 58 to allow AP233 to go out for CD ballot, following convenor review. These changes are not ideal (basically a hack!) to get the EXPRESS to parse correctly, and will need further work before AP233 progresses further.

I strongly believe the whole area of risk should have significant ISO and industrial review. Not because it is wrong, there is a lot of good work in there, but it needs better integration with the rest of STEP resource parts and current modelling styles in the modules area. Aspects such as classification, approval, identification etc. are handled in the resource schema in ways not compatible with AP233, AP239 and others, which seems very strange since this resource was developed originally to support these standards.

Since I have worked with this area from the AP233 perspective a number of times now I may be able to help with the restructuring of Risk_schema, Risk module and Risk_management module (AP233). However this is dependent on funded AP233 development work which may or may not be forthcoming.
